page.title: 10FARMING, WINTER TACK
page.content: The ewe lambs are moved to lowland or coastal pastures for the duration of their first and second winters. This practice of transhumance is known as "Tacking". The preferred localities for wintering these hill sheep are the coastal areas of West Wales. Formerly they were driven to these winter pastures, the journey occupying about a week; later they were taken there by rail from Senny- bridge station. Today they are moved by road in large two- or three-level trucks. The breeding ewes winter on the farms and are brought to the lower pastures for easier feeding during winter. Some supplementary feeding is almost essential. Because of the cold,wet springs, lambing does not begin until mid-March and continues through April.
